metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3409 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: The patch for CVE-2020-17380/CVE-2020-25085 was found to be ineffective,thus making QEMU vulnerable to the out-of-bounds read/write access issuespreviously found in the SDHCI controller emulation code. This flaw allows amalicious privileged guest to crash the QEMU process on the host, resultingin a denial of service or potential code execution. QEMU up to (including)5.2.0 is affected by this.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
